page.title: 08WYE FARM
page.content: Wye Farm,built around 1790, is owned by the Burnett family,and has 206 acres.Most of the land is arable land,with 100 acres of hay,75 acres of potatoes,about 10 acres of corn and 20 acres of straw.The farm has 452 sheep and lambs,the breeds are mainly Suffolk and Mule,they also have 35 cows(breeds are Jersey,Herefords). They have 50 battery hens which produce about 35 eggs per day.The hens are fed pellets twice daily. They sell eggs,straw,hay ,potatoes and livestock at Bakewell market. Machinery includes 5 Massey Ferguson tractors (old & new),bailers,ploughs, potatoe sorters and lumber equipment used on the farm. The farm has a milking parlour, storage places, machinery shed,livestock sheds and hay lofts.
